Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:7: Those who believe and work righteous deeds,- from them shall We blot out all evil (that may be) in them, and We shall reward them according to the best of their deeds.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:8: We have enjoined on man kindness to parents: but if they (either of them) strive (to force) thee to join with Me (in worship) anything of which thou hast no knowledge, obey them not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:9: And those who believe and work righteous deeds,- them shall We admit to the company of the Righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:10: Then there are among men such as say, "We believe in God"; but when they suffer affliction in (the cause of) God, they treat men’s oppression as if it were the Wrath of God! And if help comes (to thee) from thy Lord, they are sure to say, "We have (always) been with you!" Does not God know best all that is in the hearts of all creation?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:11: And God most certainly knows those who believe, and as certainly those who are Hypocrites.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:12: And the Unbelievers say to those who believe: "Follow our path, and we will bear (the consequences) of your faults.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:13: They will bear their own burdens, and (other) burdens along with their own, and on the Day of Judgments they will be called to account for their falsehoods.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:14: We (once) sent Noah to his people, and he tarried among them a thousand years less fifty: but the Deluge overwhelmed them while they (persisted in) sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:15: But We saved him and the companions of the Ark, and We made the (Ark) a Sign for all peoples!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:16: And (We also saved) Abraham: behold, he said to his people, "Serve God and fear Him: that will be best for you- If ye understand!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:17: "For ye do worship idols besides God, and ye invent falsehood.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:18: "And if ye reject (the Message), so did generations before you: and the duty of the apostle is only to preach publicly (and clearly).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:19: See they not how God originates creation, then repeats it: truly that is easy for God.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:20: Say: "Travel through the earth and see how God did originate creation; so will God produce a later creation: for God has power over all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:21: "He punishes whom He pleases, and He grants Mercy to whom He pleases, and towards Him are ye turned.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:22: "Not on earth nor in heaven will ye be able (fleeing) to frustrate (his Plan), nor have ye, besides God, any protector or helper.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:23: Those who reject the Signs of God and the Meeting with Him (in the Hereafter),- it is they who shall despair of My Mercy: it is they who will (suffer) a most grievous Penalty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:24: So naught was the answer of (Abraham’s) people except that they said: "Slay him or burn him.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:25: And he said: "For you, ye have taken (for worship) idols besides God, out of mutual love and regard between yourselves in this life; but on the Day of Judgment ye shall disown each other and curse each other: and your abode will be the Fire, and ye shall have none to help.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:26: But Lut had faith in Him: He said: "I will leave home for the sake of my Lord: for He is Exalted in Might, and Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:27: And We gave (Abraham) Isaac and Jacob, and ordained among his progeny Prophethood and Revelation, and We granted him his reward in this life; and he was in the Hereafter (of the company) of the Righteous.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:28: And (remember) Lut: behold, he said to his people: "Ye do commit lewdness, such as no people in Creation (ever) committed before you.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:29: "Do ye indeed approach men, and cut off the highway?- and practise wickedness (even) in your councils?" But his people gave no answer but this: they said: "Bring us the Wrath of God if thou tellest the truth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:30: He said: "O my Lord! help Thou me against people who do mischief!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:31: When Our Messengers came to Abraham with the good news, they said: "We are indeed going to destroy the people of this township: for truly they are (addicted to) crime.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:32: He said: "But there is Lut there.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:33: And when Our Messengers came to Lut, he was grieved on their account, and felt himself powerless (to protect) them: but they said: "Fear thou not, nor grieve: we are (here) to save thee and thy following, except thy wife: she is of those who lag behind.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:34: "For we are going to bring down on the people of this township a Punishment from heaven, because they have been wickedly rebellious.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:35: And We have left thereof an evident Sign, for any people who (care to) understand.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:36: To the Madyan (people) (We sent) their brother Shu’aib.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:37: But they rejected him: Then the mighty Blast seized them, and they lay prostrate in their homes by the morning.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:38: (Remember also) the ’Ad and the Thamud (people): clearly will appear to you from (the traces) of their buildings (their fate): the Evil One made their deeds alluring to them, and kept them back from the Path, though they were gifted with intelligence and skill.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:39: (Remember also) Qarun, Pharaoh, and Haman: there came to them Moses with Clear Signs, but they behaved with insolence on the earth; yet they could not overreach (Us).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:40: Each one of them We seized for his crime: of them, against some We sent a violent tornado (with showers of stones); some were caught by a (mighty) Blast; some We caused the earth to swallow up; and some We drowned (in the waters): It was not God Who injured (or oppressed) them:" They injured (and oppressed) their own souls.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:41: The parable of those who take protectors other than God is that of the spider, who builds (to itself) a house; but truly the flimsiest of houses is the spider’s house;- if they but knew.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:42: Verily God doth know of (every thing) whatever that they call upon besides Him: and He is Exalted (in power), Wise.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:43: And such are the Parables We set forth for mankind, but only those understand them who have knowledge.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:44: God created the heavens and the earth in true (proportions): verily in that is a Sign for those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:45: Recite what is sent of the Book by inspiration to thee, and establish regular Prayer: for Prayer restrains from shameful and unjust deeds; and remembrance of God is the greatest (thing in life) without doubt.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:46: And dispute ye not with the People of the Book, except with means better (than mere disputation), unless it be with those of them who inflict wrong (and injury): but say, "We believe in the revelation which has come down to us and in that which came down to you; Our God and your God is one; and it is to Him we bow (in Islam).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:47: And thus (it is) that We have sent down the Book to thee.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:48: And thou wast not (able) to recite a Book before this (Book came), nor art thou (able) to transcribe it with thy right hand: In that case, indeed, would the talkers of vanities have doubted.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:49: Nay, here are Signs self-evident in the hearts of those endowed with knowledge: and none but the unjust reject Our Signs.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:50: Ye they say: "Why are not Signs sent down to him from his Lord?" Say: "The signs are indeed with God: and I am indeed a clear Warner.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:51: And is it not enough for them that we have sent down to thee the Book which is rehearsed to them? Verily, in it is Mercy and a Reminder to those who believe.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:52: Say: "Enough is God for a witness between me and you: He knows what is in the heavens and on earth.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:53: They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment (for them): had it not been for a term (of respite) appointed, the Punishment would certainly have come to them: and it will certainly reach them,- of a sudden, while they perceive not!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:54: They ask thee to hasten on the Punishment: but, of a surety, Hell will encompass the Rejecters of Faith!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:55: On the Day that the Punishment shall cover them from above them and from below them, and (a Voice) shall say: "Taste ye (the fruits) of your deeds!"
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:56: O My servants who believe! truly, spacious is My Earth: therefore serve ye Me - (and Me alone)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:57: Every soul shall have a taste of death in the end to Us shall ye be brought back.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:58: But those who believe and work deeds of righteousness - to them shall We give a Home in Heaven,- lofty mansions beneath which flow rivers,- to dwell therein for aye;- an excellent reward for those who do (good)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:59: Those who persevere in patience, and put their trust, in their Lord and Cherisher.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:60: How many are the creatures that carry not their own sustenance? It is God who feeds (both) them and you: for He hears and knows (all things).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:61: If indeed thou ask them who has created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon (to his Law), they will certainly reply, "God".
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:62: God enlarges the sustenance (which He gives) to whichever of His servants He pleases; and He (similarly) grants by (strict) measure, (as He pleases): for God has full knowledge of all things.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:63: And if indeed thou ask them who it is that sends down rain from the sky, and gives life therewith to the earth after its death, they will certainly reply, "God!" Say, "Praise be to God!" But most of them understand not.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:64: What is the life of this world but amusement and play? but verily the Home in the Hereafter,- that is life indeed, if they but knew.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:65: Now, if they embark on a boat, they call on God, making their devotion sincerely (and exclusively) to Him; but when He has delivered them safely to (dry) land, behold, they give a share (of their worship to others)!-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:66: Disdaining ungratefully Our gifts, and giving themselves up to (worldly) enjoyment! But soon will they know.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:67: Do they not then see that We have made a sanctuary secure, and that men are being snatched away from all around them? Then, do they believe in that which is vain, and reject the Grace of God?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:68: And who does more wrong than he who invents a lie against God or rejects the Truth when it reaches him? Is there not a home in Hell for those who reject Faith?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 29:69: And those who strive in Our (cause),- We will certainly guide them to our Paths: For verily God is with those who do right.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:2: Do the people reckon that they will be left to say ’We believe,’ and will not be tried?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:3: We certainly tried those that were before them, and assuredly God knows those who speak truly, and assuredly He knows the liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:4: Or do they reckon, those who do evil deeds, that they will outstrip Us? Ill they judge!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:5: Whoso looks to encounter God, God’s term is coming; He is the All-hearing, the All-knowing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:6: Whosoever struggles, struggles only to his own gain; surely God is All-sufficient nor needs any being.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:7: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds, We shall surely acquit them of their evil deeds, and shall recompense them the best of what they were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:8: We have charged man, that he be kind to his parents; but if they strive with thee to make thee associate with Me that whereof thou hast no knowledge, then do not obey them; unto Me you shall return, and I shall tell you what you were doing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:9: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds assuredly We shall admit them among the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:10: Some men there are who say, ’We believe in God,’ but when such a man is hurt in God’s cause, he makes the persecution of men as it were God’s chastisement; then if help comes from thy Lord, he will say ’We were with you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:11: God surely knows the believers, and He knows the hypocrites.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:12: The unbelievers say to the believers, ’Follow our path, and let us carry your offences’; yet they cannot carry anything, even of their own offences; they are truly liars.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:13: They shall certainly carry their loads, and other loads along with their loads, and upon the Day of Resurrection they shall surely be questioned concerning that they were forging.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:14: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he tarried among them a thousand years, all but fifty; so the Flood seized them, while they were evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:15: Yet We delivered him, and those who were in the ship, and appointed it for a sign unto all beings.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:16: And Abraham, when he said to his people, ’Serve God, and fear Him; that is better for you, did you know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:17: You only serve, apart from God, idols and you create a calumny; those you serve, apart from God, have no power to provide for you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:18: ’But if you cry me lies, nations cried lies before you; and it is only for the Messenger to deliver the Manifest Message.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:19: (Have they not seen how God originates creation, then brings it back again? Surely that is an easy matter for God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:20: Say: Journey in the land, then behold how He originated creation; then God causes the second growth to grow; God is powerful over everything,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:21: chastising whom He will, and having mercy on whomsoever He will, and unto Him you shall be turned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:22: You are not able to frustrate Him either in the earth or in heaven; and you have not, apart from God, either protector or helper.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:23: And those who disbelieve in God’s signs and the encounter with Him -- they despair of My mercy, and there awaits them a painful chastisement.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:24: But the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Slay him, or burn him!’ Then God delivered him from the fire; surely in that are signs for a people who believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:25: And he said, ’You have only taken to yourselves idols, apart from God, as a mark of mutual love between you in the present life; then upon the Day of Resurrection you will deny one another, and you will curse one another, and your refuge will be the Fire, and you will have no helpers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:26: But Lot believed him; and he said, ’I will flee to my Lord; He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:27: And We gave him Isaac and Jacob, and We appointed the Prophecy and the Book to be among his seed; We gave him his wage in this world, and in the world to come he shall be among the righteous.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:28: And Lot, when he said to his people ’Surely you commit such indecency as never any being in all the world committed before you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:29: What, do you approach men, and cut the way, and commit in your assembly dishonour?’ But the only answer of his people was that they said, ’Then bring us the chastisement of God, if thou speakest truly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:30: He said, ’My Lord, help me against the people that work corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:31: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the good tidings, they said, ’We shall destroy the people of this city, for its people are evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:33: When that Our messengers came to Lot he was troubled on their account and distressed for them; but they said, ’Fear not, neither sorrow, for surely we shall deliver thee and thy family, except thy wife; she has become of those that tarry.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:34: We shall send down upon the people of this city wrath out of heaven for their ungodliness.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:35: And indeed, We have left thereof a sign, a clear sign? unto a people who understand.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:36: And to Midian their brother Shuaib; he said, ’O my people, serve God, and look you for the Last Day; and do not mischief in the land, working corruption.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:37: But they cried lies to him; so the earthquake seized them, and morning found them in their habitation fallen prostrate.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:38: And Ad, and Thamood -- it has become clear to you from their dwelling-places; and Satan decked out fair to them their works, and barred them from the way, though they saw clearly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:39: And Korah, and Pharaoh, and Haman; Moses came to them with the clear signs, but they waxed proud in the earth, yet they outstripped Us not.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:40: Each We seized for his sin; and of them against some We loosed a squall of pebbles and some were seized by the Cry, and some We made the earth to swallow, and some We drowned; God would never wrong them, but they wronged themselves.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:41: The likeness of those who have taken to them protectors, apart from God, is as the likeness of the spider that takes to itself a house; and surely the frailest of houses is the house of the spider, did they but know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:42: God knows whatever thing they call upon apart from Him; He is the All-mighty, the All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:43: And those similitudes -- We strike them for the people, but none understands them save those who know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:44: God created the heavens and the earth with the truth; surely in that is a sign to the believers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:45: Recite what has been revealed to thee of the Book, and perform the prayer; prayer forbids indecency and dishonour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:46: Dispute not with the People of the Book save in the fairer manner, except for those of them that do wrong; and say, ’We believe in what has been sent down to us, and what has been sent down to you; our God and your God is One, and to Him we have surrendered.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:47: Even so We have sent down to thee the Book.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:48: Not before this didst thou recite any Book, or inscribe it with thy right hand, for then those who follow falsehood would have doubted.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:49: Nay; rather it is signs, clear signs in the breasts of those who have been given knowledge; and none denies Our signs but the evildoers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:50: They say, ’Why have signs not been gent down upon him from his Lord?’ Say: ’The signs are only with God, and I am only a plain warner.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:51: What, is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down upon thee the Book that is recited to them? Surely in that is a mercy, and a reminder to a people who believe.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:52: Say: ’God suffices as a witness between me and you.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:53: And they demand of thee to hasten the chastisement! But for a stated term the chastisement would have come upon them; but it shall come upon them suddenly, when they are not aware.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:54: They demand of thee to hasten the chastisement! Lo, Gehenna encompasses the unbelievers.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:55: Upon the day the chastisement shall overwhelm them from above them and from under their feet, and He shall say, ’Taste now what you were doing!’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:56: O My servants who believe, surely My earth is wide; therefore Me do you serve!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:57: Every soul shall taste of death; then unto Us you shall be returned.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:58: And those who believe, and do righteous deeds, We shall surely lodge them in lofty chambers of paradise, underneath which rivers flow, therein dwelling forever; and excellent is the wage of those who labour,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:59: such men as are patient, and put their trust in their Lord.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:60: How many a beast that bears not its own provision, but God provides for it and you! He is the All-hearer, the All-knower.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:61: If thou askest them, ’Who created the heavens and the earth and subjected the sun and the moon?’ they will say, ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:62: God outspreads and straitens His provision to whomsoever He will of His servants; God has knowledge of everything.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:63: If thou askest them, ’Who sends down out of heaven water, and therewith revives the earth after it is dead?’ they will say, ’God.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:64: This present life is naught but a diversion and a sport; surely the Last Abode is Life, did they but know.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:65: When they embark in the ships, they call on God, making their religion sincerely His; but when He has delivered them to the land, they associate others with Him,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:66: that they may be ungrateful for what We have given them, and take their enjoyment; they will soon know!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:67: Have they not seen that We have appointed a sanctuary secure, while all about them the people are snatched away? What, do they believe in vanity, and do they disbelieve in God’s blessing?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:68: And who does greater evil than he who forges against God a lie, or cries lies to the truth when it comes to him? What, is there not in Gehenna a lodging for the unbelievers?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 29:69: But those who struggle in Our cause, surely We shall guide them in Our ways; and God is with the good-doers.

Muhammad Asad.verse 29:2: DO MEN THINK that on their
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:3: saying, "We have attained to faith," they will be left to themselves, and will not be put to a test?
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:4: Yea, indeed, We did test those who lived before them; and so, [too, shall be tested the people now living: and] most certainly will God mark out those who prove themselves true, and most certainly will He mark out those who are lying.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:5: Or do they think – they who do evil deeds [while claiming to have attained to faith] – that they can escape Us? Bad, indeed, is their judgment!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:6: Whoever looks forward [with hope and awe] to meeting God [on Resurrection Day, let him be ready for it]: for, behold, the end set by God [for everyone’s life] is bound to come – and He alone is all-hearing, all-knowing!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:7: Hence, whoever strives hard [in God’s cause] does so only for his own good: for, verily, God does not stand in need of anything in all the worlds!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:8: And as for those who attain to faith and do righteous deeds, We shall most certainly efface their
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:9: bad deeds, and shall most certainly reward them in accordance with the best that they ever did.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:10: Now [among the best of righteous deeds which] We have enjoined upon man
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:11: goodness towards his parents; yet [even so,] should they endeavour to make thee ascribe divinity, side by side with Me, to something which thy mind cannot accept [as divine], obey them not:
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:12: it is unto Me that you all must return, whereupon I shall make you
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:13: understand [the right and wrong of] all that you were doing [in life].
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:14: But as for those who have attained to faith and have done righteous deeds, We shall most certainly cause them to join the righteous [in the hereafter as well].
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:15: NOW THERE IS among men many a one who says [of himself and of others like him], "We do believe in God" – but whenever he is made to suffer in God’s cause, he thinks that persecution at the hands of man is as [much to be feared, or even more than,] God’s chastisement; whereas, if succour from thy Sustainer comes [to those who truly believe], he is sure to say, "Behold, we have always been with you!" Is not God fully aware of what is in the hearts of all creatures?
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:16: [Yea –] and most certainly will God mark out those who have
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:17: attained to faith, and most certainly will He mark out the hypocrites.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:18: And [He is aware, too, that] they who are bent on denying the truth speak [thus, as it were,] to those who have attained to faith: "Follow our way [of life], and we shall indeed take your sins upon ourselves !" But never could they take upon themselves aught of the sins of those [whom they would thus mislead]: behold, they are liars indeed!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:19: Yet most certainly will they have to bear their own burdens, and other burdens besides their own; and most certainly will they be called to account on Resurrection Day for all their false assertions!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:20: AND, INDEED, [in times long past] We sent forth Noah unto his people, and he dwelt among them a thousand years bar fifty; and then the floods overwhelmed them while they were still lost in evildoing:
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:21: but We saved him, together with all who were in the ark, which We then set up as a symbol [of Our grace] for all people [to remember].
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:22: AND ABRAHAM, [too, was inspired by Us] when he said unto his people: "Worship God, and be conscious of Him: this is the best for you, if you but knew it!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:25: you give visible shape to a lie! Behold, those [things and beings] that you worship instead of God have it not in their power to provide sustenance for you: seek, then, all
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:26: sustenance from God, and worship Him
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:28: unto Him you shall be brought back!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:31: communities have given the lie [to God’s prophets] before your time: but no more is an apostle bound to do than clearly deliver the message [entrusted to him].
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:32: ARE, THEN, they [who deny the truth] not aware of how God creates
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:33: in the first instance, and then brings it forth anew? This, verily, is easy for God!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:34: Say: "Go all over the earth and behold how
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:36: in the first instance: and thus, too, will God bring into being your second life – for, verily, God has the power to will anything!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:37: "He causes to suffer whomever He wills, and bestows His mercy on whomever He wills; and unto Him you shall be made to return:
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:38: and never – not on earth and not in the skies – can you [hope to] elude Him; and you have none to protect you from God, and none to bring you succour.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:39: And [thus it is:] they who are bent on denying the truth of God’s messages and of their
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:40: meeting with Him – it is they who abandon all hope of My grace and mercy: and it is they whom grievous suffering awaits [in the life to come].
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:41: NOW [as for Abraham,] his people’s only answer was, "Slay him, or burn him!" – but God saved him from the fire.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:42: there are messages indeed for people who will believe!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:44: said: "You have chosen to worship idols instead of God for no other reason than to have a bond of love, in the life of this world, between yourselves [and your forebears]: but then, on Resurrection Day, you shall disown one another and curse one another – for the goal of you all will be the fire, and you will have none to succour you.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:45: Thereupon [his brother’s son] Lot came to believe in him and said: "Verily, I
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:46: shall forsake the domain of evil [and turn] to my Sustainer: for, verily, He alone is almighty, truly wise!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:47: And [as for Abraham,] We bestowed upon him Isaac and [Isaac’s son] Jacob, and caused prophethood and revelation to continue among his offspring.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:48: he shall find himself among the righteous.
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:49: AND LOT, [too, was inspired by Us] when he said unto his people: "Verily, you commit abominations such as none in all the world has ever committed before you!
Muhammad Asad.verse 29:50: Must you indeed approach men [with lust], and thus cut across the way [of nature]? – and must you commit these shameful deeds in your

Muhammad Asad.verse 29:82: And yet they say, "Why have no miraculous signs ever been bestowed upon him from on high by his Sustainer?" Say: "Miracles are in the power of God alone; and as for me – I am but a plain warner.

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:2: Do people think that they will be left (at ease) only on their saying, “We believe” and will not be put to any test?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:3: Indeed We have tested those who were before them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:4: Or do those who commit evils think that they will outstrip Us? Evil is what they predicate.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:5: Whoever hopes to meet Allah (must be sure that) Allah’s appointed time has to come, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:6: Whoever strives, strives for his own benefit.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:7: Those who believe and do righteous deeds, We will expiate their bad deeds and will give them a better reward (than their expectation) for what they used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:8: We have instructed man to do good to his parents.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:9: And those who believe and do righteous deeds, We shall include them among the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:10: Among men there are those who say, “We believe in Allah”, but when they are persecuted in (the way of) Allah, they take the persecution of men, as equal to the punishment of Allah.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:11: Allah will certainly know those who believe and He will certainly know the hypocrites.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:12: Those who disbelieve say to those who believe, “Follow our way, and we will bear the burden of your sins.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:13: They shall certainly bear their own loads, and some other loads along with their own loads, and they will certainly be questioned about what they used to forge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:14: We sent NūH to his people.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:15: So We saved him and the people of the Ark, and made it a sign for all the worlds.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:16: And (We sent) Ibrāhīm when he said to his people, “Worship Allah and fear Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:17: You only worship idols beside Allah, and you invent a lie.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:18: And if you reject me, then many nations have rejected their messengers before you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:19: Did they not see how Allah originates the creation, then He will do it again.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:20: Say, “Go about in the land and look how He has originated the creation.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:21: He punishes whom He wills and has mercy on whom He wills.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:22: You are not (able) to frustrate (Allah) neither in the earth nor in the sky.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:23: And those who deny the signs of Allah and meeting with Him - those will despair of My mercy, and those are the ones for whom there is a painful punishment.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:24: So, the response of his (Ibrāhīm) people was none but that they said, “Kill him” or “Burn him”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:25: And he (Ibrāhīm) said, “You have adopted idols instead of Allah, only because of love (you have) with each other in the worldly life.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:26: So LūT believed in him, and he (Ibrāhīm) said, “I am going to leave my homeland towards my Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:27: And We granted him IsHāq (Isaac) and Ya‘qūb (Jacob), and assigned prophet-hood and Book to his progeny, and gave him his reward in the world; and of course, in the Hereafter, he will be one of the righteous.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:28: And (We sent) LūT when he said to his people, “Indeed you commit the shameful act that no one in the worlds has ever preceded you in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:29: Is it (not) a fact that you go for men (to satisfy your lust) and rob the wayfarers and commit evil in your gathering?” So the answer of his people was none but that they said, “Bring us Allah’s punishment, if you are one of the truthful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:30: He said, “My Lord, help me against the people who make mischief.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:31: And when Our messengers came to Ibrāhīm with the good news, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this town.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:32: He said, “There is LūT in it.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:33: And when Our messengers came to LūT, he grieved for them and his heart was straitened because of them, but they said, “We are going to save you and your family, except your wife who will be among those remaining behind.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:34: We are going to bring down on the people of this town a punishment from the sky, because they used to act sinfully.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:35: And We left from it (the town) an evident sign for a people who understand.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:36: And (We sent) to Madyan their brother Shu‘aib.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:37: So they gave the lie to him, then they were seized by the earthquake and they remained in their homes lying on their faces.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:38: And (We destroyed) ‘Ād and Thamūd, and it is visible to you through their dwellings.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:39: And (We also destroyed) Qārūn and Pharaoh and Hāmān.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:40: Thus We seized each one of them for his sin.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:41: The example of those who have adopted patrons other than Allah is like the spider that has made a house, while indeed the weakest of houses is the house of the spider.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:42: Surely, Allah knows whatever thing they invoke beside Allah, and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:43: We site these examples for people, but no one understands them except the knowledgeable ones.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:44: Allah has created the heavens and the earth with truth.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:45: Recite (O Prophet) what is revealed to you of the Book, and establish Salāh .
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:46: Do not debate with the people of the Book unless it is in the best manner, except with those of them who commit injustice.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:47: Thus We have sent down the Book to you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:48: You (O Prophet,) have never been reciting any book before this, nor have you been writing it with your right hand; had it been so, the adherents of falsehood would have raised doubts.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:49: But it (the Qur’ān in itself) is (a package of) evident signs in the hearts of those who are given knowledge.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:50: And they say, “Why is it that no signs (miracles) have been sent down to him from his Lord?” Say, “Signs are only with Allah, and I am only a plain warner.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:51: Is it not sufficient for them that We have sent down to you the Book that is being recited to them? Surely in it there is mercy and advice for a people who believe.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:52: Say, “Allah is enough as a witness between me and you.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:53: They ask you to bring the punishment soon.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:54: They ask you to bring the punishment soon, while the Jahannam is surely going to engulf the disbelievers
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:55: on the Day when the punishment will envelop them from above them and from under their feet and He (Allah) will say, “Taste what you used to do.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:56: O My servants who believe, surely My earth is vast.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:57: Every person has to taste death, then to Us you are to be returned.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:58: As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, We shall accommodate them in mansions of the Paradise beneath which rivers flow, where they will live forever.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:59: who observe restraint patiently and place their trust in their Lord alone.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:60: How many an animal there is that does not carry its provision.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:61: If you ask them as to who has created the heavens and the earth and has subjugated the sun and the moon, they will certainly say, “Allah”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:62: Allah extends provision to whom He wills from His servants, and straitens it (for whom He wills).
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:63: And if you ask them as to who sends down water from the sky, then revives the land with it, they will certainly say, “Allah”.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:64: This worldly life is nothing but an amusement and play, and the Last Abode is the real life indeed.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:65: So when they embark on a ship, they invoke Allah, having their faith purely in Him.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:66: thus becoming ungrateful for what We gave to them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:67: Did they not see that We have made a peaceful sanctuary (Haram ) while (other) people around them are being snatched away? Do they still believe in falsity and reject Allah’s grace?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:68: Who is more unjust than the one who forges a lie against Allah or rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is there not in Jahannam a home for disbelievers?
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 29:69: As for those who strive in Our way, We will certainly take them onto Our paths, and indeed Allah is with those who are good in deeds.
